_header: A holy man stood on a day
_description: A Man in the Devil’s leash, in the Northern Homily Cycle — in couplets

BodSelSup52.First Lines:
A holy man stoyd on adayIn a kyrk ȝerd hys beydes to
                    say…
BodSelSup52.Last Lines:
…On hym þat hath doyn hym wrangþer apon he thynkes
                    lang

BodAsh42.First Lines:
A hali man stode on a daieIn a kirk garthe his bedes to saie
                    …
BodAsh42.Last Lines:
…þat ihesu criste þe waie vs ledeTo heuene blisse to
                    take oure mede
BodAsh42.Editions:
Thompson,  Anne B.,
                        ed.  
             The Northern Homily
                    Cycle.
         Kalamazoo, MI: Western Michigan University for TEAMS, 2008.

CULAdd8335.First Lines:
An holi man stode on o dayIn a kirk ȝerde his bedes to
                    say…
CULAdd8335.Last Lines:
…Þat ihesu crist þat way vs ledeTo heuen blisse to
                    take oure mede
CULAdd8335.Attributed Title:
narracio de diabolo ducente quem peccatorem in cathena (p.
                    164)

CULDd11.First Lines:
An holy man stod on a dayin a kirkeȝerd his bedis to
                    say…
CULDd11.Last Lines:
…Þat ihesu crist þat wey vs ledeto heuene blisse to
                    take oure mede

BLAdd38010.First Lines:
A haly man stode opon a dayIn kirke yerde his bedes to
                    say…
BLAdd38010.Last Lines:
…That ihesu cryst vs þat say ledeTo heuens blys to take
                    our mede

BLHar2391.First Lines: A holy hermit stode on a dayIn a kyrk ȝerde hys bedis to sey…
BLHar2391.Last Lines: …þat Ihesu crist þe way vs ledeto heuen blys to tak owre mede
BLHar2391.Attributed Title: Dominica in rammys palmarum (left margin, f. 184v), with “A tale” written above it
BLHar2391.Editions:
Rosenthal,  Constance Lowegrund. 
             The Vitae Patrum in Old and Middle English Literature.
         Philadelphia, 1936; repr. Folcroft, PA: Folcroft Library,
            1974: 161.

BLHar4196.First Lines: …And als he in his prayers stodefful many men vnto kirk ȝode…
BLHar4196.Last Lines: …Þeder he bring vs all and sumÞat for oure kind wal[d] þeþin cum
BLHar4196.Note: Missing lines 1-2 due to loss of folio.
BLHar4196.Editions:
Nevanlinna,  Sara. 
             The Northern Homily Cycle: The Expanded Version in MSS Harley 4196 and Cotton Tiberius E.vii.
             3 vols. 
             Memoires de la Societé Neophilologique de Helsinki.
         Helsinki. 38 (1972); 41 (1973); and 43 (1984): I.144-148.

MinULZ822.First Lines:
Ane haly man stode on a dayin a kyrke hys bedys to
                    say…
MinULZ822.Last Lines:
…þat Ihesu cryste he wyll vs ledeTyll heuene blysse to
                    take oure mede

HunHM129.First Lines:
A holy man stode on a dayIn a kyrk ȝarde his beddis to
                    say…
HunHM129.Last Lines:
…Þat ihesu þat way vs ledeTo heuyn us blys to mak
                    oure mede
